GOD.content: Derrida starts w/ Phaedo, w/ meletē tou thanatou, w/ Socrates’ play on aïdēs (“one who doesn’t see”) & haidēs, references Levinas, Heidegger, then: care about dying as relation to self, mystery or secrecy in formation of psychē
GOD.linkedContent: Derrida starts w/ Phaedo, w/ meletē tou thanatou, w/ Socrates’ play on aïdēs (“one who doesn’t see”) & haidēs, references Levinas, Heidegger, then: care about dying as relation to self, mystery or secrecy in formation of psychē

GOD.content: philosophy from the start, vigil (veille) over death that watches out for death and watches over death (qui veille à la mort et sur elle), as if over the very life of the soul, psychē as life, breath, pneuma, caring anticipation of dying, provisional mourning, vigil as veillée and wake [in English]
GOD.linkedContent: philosophy from the start, vigil (veille) over death that watches out for death and watches over death (qui veille à la mort et sur elle), as if over the very life of the soul, psychē as life, breath, pneuma, caring anticipation of dying, provisional mourning, vigil as veillée and wake [in English]

GOD.content: approach, apprehending, anticipating death (see coming what one can’t see, give oneself what one can probably never give in pure or simple way) [each approach confers on death a different value]
GOD.linkedContent: approach, apprehending, anticipating death (see coming what one can’t see, give oneself what one can probably never give in pure or simple way) [each approach confers on death a different value]

GOD.content: trembling before the unforeseeable, what cannot be apprehended
GOD.linkedContent: trembling before the unforeseeable, what cannot be apprehended

GT.content: temporalization of time (memory, present, anticipation, pro, re-tention, imminence of future, “ecstases”) destroys the gift via keeping (la garde), restitution, comprehending in advance
GT.linkedContent: temporalization of time (memory, present, anticipation, pro, re-tention, imminence of future, “ecstases”) destroys the gift via keeping (la garde), restitution, comprehending in advance

GT.content: Heidegger: to look ahead (vorblicken) to the It (Es) which gives (gibt) Being (Sein) & time (Zeit), we try to bring the It and its Being into view, capitalize the “It”, become foresighted
GT.linkedContent: Heidegger: to look ahead (vorblicken) to the It (Es) which gives (gibt) Being (Sein) & time (Zeit), we try to bring the It and its Being into view, capitalize the “It”, become foresighted

GT.content: can one ask these questions (i.e. what is a gift?) w/out anticipating a thought?
GT.linkedContent: can one ask these questions (i.e. what is a gift?) w/out anticipating a thought?

GT.content: “semantic horizon of anticipation that authorizes….” him [Marcel Mauss] to gather together phenomena of diverse sorts
GT.linkedContent: “semantic horizon of anticipation that authorizes….” him [Marcel Mauss] to gather together phenomena of diverse sorts

GT.content: the foreseeable, programmed, conditioned, expected, counted on, necessary cannot be a gift or event
GT.linkedContent: the foreseeable, programmed, conditioned, expected, counted on, necessary cannot be a gift or event

GT.content: event, gift, must be structured by aleatory, remain unforeseeable w/out being kept so
GT.linkedContent: event, gift, must be structured by aleatory, remain unforeseeable w/out being kept so

R.content: anticipate the idea of democracy, a little bit, we would never seek nor call for its advent if we didn’t know its idea, somewhat, but still tortured by the wheel.
R.linkedContent: anticipate the idea of democracy, a little bit, we would never seek nor call for its advent if we didn’t know its idea, somewhat, but still tortured by the wheel.

R.content: [Derrida on 9/11]: not as unforeseeable as everyone claimed; the trauma that occurred, not what actually happened, but apprehension of a worse threat still to come
R.linkedContent: [Derrida on 9/11]: not as unforeseeable as everyone claimed; the trauma that occurred, not what actually happened, but apprehension of a worse threat still to come

R.content: autoimmunity, cruelty itself, autoinfection of all autoaffectivity, the self, ipse, autos finds itself infected (once it needs event, time, other) precedes or anticipates oppositions btwn physis & its others (tekhnē, nomos, thesis) > life-death
R.linkedContent: autoimmunity, cruelty itself, autoinfection of all autoaffectivity, the self, ipse, autos finds itself infected (once it needs event, time, other) precedes or anticipates oppositions btwn physis & its others (tekhnē, nomos, thesis) > life-death

POOF.content: for Nietzsche, if woman is not even part of humanity [via inability to befriend], man is not yet man either, men are equally late [Augustine], though woman lagging > be patient in the face of this ‘not yet’: mourned anticipation, a threshold naming—May we have it one day!
POOF.linkedContent: for Nietzsche, if woman is not even part of humanity [via inability to befriend], man is not yet man either, men are equally late [Augustine], though woman lagging > be patient in the face of this ‘not yet’: mourned anticipation, a threshold naming—May we have it one day!

OOG.content: “horizon is always virtually present in every experience; for it is at once the unity and incompletion, the anticipated unity in every incompletion” > keeps infinite openness in tact, converting critical philosophy’s state of possibility into concrete infinite potentiality
OOG.linkedContent: “horizon is always virtually present in every experience; for it is at once the unity and incompletion, the anticipated unity in every incompletion” > keeps infinite openness in tact, converting critical philosophy’s state of possibility into concrete infinite potentiality

OOG.content: “horizon-certainty,” “horizon-knowledge,” “horizon-consciousness,” horizon as already there of the future
OOG.linkedContent: “horizon-certainty,” “horizon-knowledge,” “horizon-consciousness,” horizon as already there of the future

OOG.content: for anticipation to leap to the infinite, it must already be ideal, anticipation authorizes and prescribes presence for consciousness of an Idea in the Kantian Sense (not imaginary)
OOG.linkedContent: for anticipation to leap to the infinite, it must already be ideal, anticipation authorizes and prescribes presence for consciousness of an Idea in the Kantian Sense (not imaginary)

OOG.content: phenomenology: starts from a lived anticipation [Idea in Kantian sense would be operative not thematic] as radical responsibility absent in Kant
OOG.linkedContent: phenomenology: starts from a lived anticipation [Idea in Kantian sense would be operative not thematic] as radical responsibility absent in Kant

OOG.content: phenomenological determination of Idea radically impossible: Logos can’t be given in philosophy of seeing, but (like all Speech) can only be understood in visible > Endstiftung of phenomenology (its ultimate legitimation) never directly measures up to phenomenology
OOG.linkedContent: phenomenological determination of Idea radically impossible: Logos can’t be given in philosophy of seeing, but (like all Speech) can only be understood in visible > Endstiftung of phenomenology (its ultimate legitimation) never directly measures up to phenomenology

FK.content: “the future tolerates neither foresight nor providence”

MC.content: there is no chance for anticipation, it sees the ob-ject [the thrown], Gegenstand, before it
MC.linkedContent: there is no chance for anticipation, it sees the ob-ject [the thrown], Gegenstand, before it

H.content: law of hospitality commands host gives arrivant, “new arrival,” an unconditional welcome; no anticipation
H.linkedContent: law of hospitality commands host gives arrivant, “new arrival,” an unconditional welcome; no anticipation

H.content: we are always in some way late; “the consciousness only anticipates, ever, one delay too many”
H.linkedContent: we are always in some way late; “the consciousness only anticipates, ever, one delay too many”

H.content: p. anne 34 Derrida risks a discourse where nothing is planned, risks misunderstanding
H.linkedContent: p. anne 34 Derrida risks a discourse where nothing is planned, risks misunderstanding

AF.content: affirmation of affirmation, yes, yes, “inaugural engagement of a promise or of an anticipation which wagers, a priori, the very future”
AF.linkedContent: affirmation of affirmation, yes, yes, “inaugural engagement of a promise or of an anticipation which wagers, a priori, the very future”

AF.content: is Jewishness the absolute uniqueness of this trait? to be open toward the future (à-venir), to be Jewish?: exemplary uniqueness of the trait d’union [btwn Jewishness & future]
AF.linkedContent: is Jewishness the absolute uniqueness of this trait? to be open toward the future (à-venir), to be Jewish?: exemplary uniqueness of the trait d’union [btwn Jewishness & future]

MPM.content: promise: not expectation or anticipation but commitment

A.content: for Heidegger, all interest, belief in immortality, man’s irreducible torsion of retrospective anticipation (survival structure) in every instant (introduces untimely moment and posthumous in most alive of present living thing), stems from man’s mortality—is secondary [to being-toward-death] > only a “being-to-death” can think, desire, project, live immortality as such
A.linkedContent: for Heidegger, all interest, belief in immortality, man’s irreducible torsion of retrospective anticipation (survival structure) in every instant (introduces untimely moment and posthumous in most alive of present living thing), stems from man’s mortality—is secondary [to being-toward-death] > only a “being-to-death” can think, desire, project, live immortality as such

SEC.content: to pose a kind of question—anticipate meaning
SEC.linkedContent: to pose a kind of question—anticipate meaning

VM.content: can a method be borrowed like a tool? method always shelters, anticipates the being which one encounters > this is why, since Plato, decision of philosophy has always seen itself as a science
VM.linkedContent: can a method be borrowed like a tool? method always shelters, anticipates the being which one encounters > this is why, since Plato, decision of philosophy has always seen itself as a science

VM.content: “ontological” anticipation, transcendence toward Being, helps us understand God, even as ether in which dissonance resonates > inhabits & founds language, Mitsein, all Being-together
VM.linkedContent: “ontological” anticipation, transcendence toward Being, helps us understand God, even as ether in which dissonance resonates > inhabits & founds language, Mitsein, all Being-together

PAS.content: the thing can appear near only to what anticipates what the near and proximity are, right there
PAS.linkedContent: the thing can appear near only to what anticipates what the near and proximity are, right there

OH.content: every history, history of a culture, has a telos (promise, memory) toward which it dreams of gathering itself > anticipation & telos; and every history cannot be identified in advance, unanticipatable, non-masterable, that of which one has no memory
OH.linkedContent: every history, history of a culture, has a telos (promise, memory) toward which it dreams of gathering itself > anticipation & telos; and every history cannot be identified in advance, unanticipatable, non-masterable, that of which one has no memory

T.content: how to put one’s hands on tympanum so it can escape from hands of philosopher, so he can no longer recognize his phallogocentrism [play w/ mains, maintenant, maintain], no longer rediscover himself, no longer able to say: I will have anticipated it w/ absolute knowledge
T.linkedContent: how to put one’s hands on tympanum so it can escape from hands of philosopher, so he can no longer recognize his phallogocentrism [play w/ mains, maintenant, maintain], no longer rediscover himself, no longer able to say: I will have anticipated it w/ absolute knowledge

PPHS.content: theory of sign on basis of being-present, authority of l’être-en-vue: telos of reappropriation [see POOF p. 65], coordination of sign & light of parousia, speaking logos as close as possible to itself in concept & consciousness
PPHS.linkedContent: theory of sign on basis of being-present, authority of l’être-en-vue: telos of reappropriation [see POOF p. 65], coordination of sign & light of parousia, speaking logos as close as possible to itself in concept & consciousness

F.content: Torok and Abraham’s method, goes beyond anticipations of a program: introduced an essential déportment (unruliness) [re: “transphenomenology,” relay, conversion]
F.linkedContent: Torok and Abraham’s method, goes beyond anticipations of a program: introduced an essential déportment (unruliness) [re: “transphenomenology,” relay, conversion]

P.content: lemmatic precipitation, anticipatory conceptualizing, recourse to metaphor of circle, circle of circles, metaphor of organic whole [re: Hegel & philosophy as work of art]
P.linkedContent: lemmatic precipitation, anticipatory conceptualizing, recourse to metaphor of circle, circle of circles, metaphor of organic whole [re: Hegel & philosophy as work of art]

SP.content: this death [in text] not that of tragedy nor subject, not “I am mortal, therefore…” > the scene of text’s cryptic nature makes possible anticipation of death: tragedy, parody & birth
SP.linkedContent: this death [in text] not that of tragedy nor subject, not “I am mortal, therefore…” > the scene of text’s cryptic nature makes possible anticipation of death: tragedy, parody & birth

GSP.content: Telos/Vorhaben > infinite theoretical anticipation & infinite practical task: Kantian Idea as project of phenom.? makes it possible by overflowing its system (as its end?) > doesn’t enclose genesis of Being & meaning—is structurally genesis itself: origin/becoming, birth of history
GSP.linkedContent: Telos/Vorhaben > infinite theoretical anticipation & infinite practical task: Kantian Idea as project of phenom.? makes it possible by overflowing its system (as its end?) > doesn’t enclose genesis of Being & meaning—is structurally genesis itself: origin/becoming, birth of history

FS.content: structuralist totality promises infidelity to telos, but: structures must permit totality to open, overflow itself, totality thus takes on meaning by anticipating telos > an opening which liberates genesis and time but risks stifling force under futural becoming of teleological form
FS.linkedContent: structuralist totality promises infidelity to telos, but: structures must permit totality to open, overflow itself, totality thus takes on meaning by anticipating telos > an opening which liberates genesis and time but risks stifling force under futural becoming of teleological form

O.content: absolute knowledge present at 0 point of philosophical exposition: saturate text w/ meaning (sens), teleologically equate it [the text?] w/ its (sa) conceptual tenor
O.linkedContent: absolute knowledge present at 0 point of philosophical exposition: saturate text w/ meaning (sens), teleologically equate it [the text?] w/ its (sa) conceptual tenor

O.content: point of ontotheological fusion reduces precipitation & after-affect (dehiscence btwn vouloir-dire & writing, anticipation & recapitulation) to sublatables [mouvement de tête]
O.linkedContent: point of ontotheological fusion reduces precipitation & after-affect (dehiscence btwn vouloir-dire & writing, anticipation & recapitulation) to sublatables [mouvement de tête]

O.content: teleological anticipation: soothing order of future perfect
O.linkedContent: teleological anticipation: soothing order of future perfect

SW.content: expecting w/out knowing, thus w/out expecting [?]
SW.linkedContent: expecting w/out knowing, thus w/out expecting [?]

RGE.content: the other dawn (awake from slumber of reason—which anticipated all figures of its beyond, all forms & resources of its exterior—except, perhaps, laughter)
RGE.linkedContent: the other dawn (awake from slumber of reason—which anticipated all figures of its beyond, all forms & resources of its exterior—except, perhaps, laughter)

PIO.content: invention’s “first time”: inaugural event and iterability > thus, no invention w/out status, w/out introduction or promise of publicity; iterability marked, remarked, at origin of invention, elle y forme une poche du premier instant: retroverted anticipation
PIO.linkedContent: invention’s “first time”: inaugural event and iterability > thus, no invention w/out status, w/out introduction or promise of publicity; iterability marked, remarked, at origin of invention, elle y forme une poche du premier instant: retroverted anticipation

PIO.content: to invent is to produce iterability & the machine for reproduction/simulation
PIO.linkedContent: to invent is to produce iterability & the machine for reproduction/simulation

OG.content: that the “imprint” is irreducible means speech is passive in relation to an absolute past that can never be fully mastered, brought to presence > this passivity of speech is also a relation to the future, but not via anticipation [which would be a mastering of passivity]
OG.linkedContent: that the “imprint” is irreducible means speech is passive in relation to an absolute past that can never be fully mastered, brought to presence > this passivity of speech is also a relation to the future, but not via anticipation [which would be a mastering of passivity]

OG.content: should (devrait) is the mode and tense (temps) of the teleological/eschatological anticipation that surveils Rousseau’s discourse
OG.linkedContent: should (devrait) is the mode and tense (temps) of the teleological/eschatological anticipation that surveils Rousseau’s discourse
